headline: Ford CEO: US trade deal with Mexico, Canada 'critical for our country'
summary: Ford (F) plans to pivot on its EV strategy in 2026 to better compete with Chinese automakers, including a more focused approach to hybrid vehicles as the US company cancels its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line. Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to address a variety of topics, including the "critical" points of the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the Big Three automaker's refreshed perspective on electrification trends and EV demand, the new vehicles announced at the event, and the company's partnership with Formula One racing teams. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Ford CEO: US trade deal with Mexico, Canada 'critical for our country'
content.description:
Ford (F) plans to pivot on its EV strategy in 2026 to better compete with Chinese automakers, including a more focused approach to hybrid vehicles as the US company cancels its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line.

Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to address a variety of topics, including the "critical" points of the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the Big Three automaker's refreshed perspective on electrification trends and EV demand, the new vehicles announced at the event, and the company's partnership with Formula One racing teams.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: White House Always Answers the Phone, Ford CEO Says
summary: Ford Motor Co. Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley says the Trump administration will "always answer the phone" and has been great to work with, but he says there is still a long list of issues to work through. He speaks to Bloomberg's Matt Miller.

content.title: White House Always Answers the Phone, Ford CEO Says
content.description: Ford Motor Co. Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley says the Trump administration will "always answer the phone" and has been great to work with, but he says there is still a long list of issues to work through. He speaks to Bloomberg's Matt Miller.

headline: Ford, BYD in talks for hybrid vehicle battery deal, WSJ reports
summary: Jan 15 () - Ford ​and BYD ‌are in ‌talks about batteries for hybrid ⁠vehicles ‌as the Detroit automaker ‍deals with waning demand ​for electric ‌vehicles, the Wall Street Journal reported on ⁠Thursday, ​citing ​people familiar with the ‍matter. (Reporting ⁠by Nathan Gomes in ⁠Bengaluru; Editing ‌by Shilpi ‌Majumdar).

summary: A deal, if completed, would likely involve Ford buying BYD batteries for its factories outside the U.S., according to people familiar with the matter.

headline: Ford CEO explains what the US auto industry got wrong about EVs
summary: US automaker Ford (F) looks to pivot from its EV strategy in 2026 in a bid to compete with Chinese competitors as electric vehicle demand wanes in the US. The car company recently announced its hybrid-centric approach moving forward while cancelling its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line. Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to discuss the auto manufacturer's renewed outlook on EVs and electrification trends. Watch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley by clicking here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Ford CEO explains what the US auto industry got wrong about EVs
content.description:
US automaker Ford (F) looks to pivot from its EV strategy in 2026 in a bid to compete with Chinese competitors as electric vehicle demand wanes in the US. The car company recently announced its hybrid-centric approach moving forward while cancelling its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line.

Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to discuss the auto manufacturer's renewed outlook on EVs and electrification trends.

Watch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley by clicking here.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: China's Tesla-Crushing EV Company Creeps Into U.S. Market
summary: BYD overtook Tesla to become the world's leading EV company. Now, the possibility of breaking into the American car market is closer than ever, as President Donald Trump opens the door for Chinese car factories in the U.S.

content.title: China's Tesla-Crushing EV Company Creeps Into U.S. Market
content.summary: BYD overtook Tesla to become the world's leading EV company. Now, the possibility of breaking into the American car market is closer than ever, as President Donald Trump opens the door for Chinese car factories in the U.S.
